guide.introduction_rendered:
Tools
  • Dremel tool with cutting, grinding, or routing bits
  • Scissors
  • Sharpie
  • Tape measure

lines.text: Got an old tool case, like this orbital sander case? Also have a DSLR camera that needs a safe home? Look no farther my friend.
lines.text_raw: Got an old tool case, like this orbital sander case? Also have a DSLR camera that needs a safe home? Look no farther my friend.

lines.text: First, find a case that is big enough for your camera. I was about to throw out a DeWalt sander case, because seriously, who needs a case for a sander?!?
lines.text_raw: First, find a case that is big enough for your camera. I was about to throw out a DeWalt sander case, because seriously, who needs a case for a sander?!?

lines.text: Then use a Dremel or similar tool to grind out all the plastic dividers and leave one wide-open cavity.
lines.text_raw: Then use a Dremel or similar tool to grind out all the plastic dividers and leave one wide-open cavity.

lines.text: Get your hands on some pick-and-pluck foam sheet. I got mine online here. Just measure the inside volume of the case and order a little more than you will need.
lines.text_raw: Get your hands on some pick-and-pluck foam sheet. I got mine online [http://www.caseclub.com/pick-and-pluck-foam.htm|here]. Just measure the inside volume of the case and order a little more than you will need.

lines.text: Next figure out what you need to do to fit the foam snugly in the case. The thinner the layers, the more detailed the mold can be.
lines.text_raw: Next figure out what you need to do to fit the foam snugly in the case. The thinner the layers, the more detailed the mold can be.

lines.text: Put the camera on the foam and trace it with a sharpie. After a layer or two start making a void for the camera.
lines.text_raw: Put the camera on the foam and trace it with a sharpie. After a layer or two start making a void for the camera.

lines.text: Add layers until the foam reaches the lip of the bottom half of the case. You can also remove sections for extra lenses and the carry strap. I just fold up the strap and sandwich it in behind the camera.
lines.text_raw: Add layers until the foam reaches the lip of the bottom half of the case. You can also remove sections for extra lenses and the carry strap. I just fold up the strap and sandwich it in behind the camera.

guide.summary: I took an old DeWalt sander case and turned it into a camera case for my DSLR. It's fancy and I get a lot of compliments on it.
guide.title: DSLR Camera Case from an Old Toolbox
